name: lmod0vcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, cgrp))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ LMod, c1 ∈ c2, c0 ∈ Grp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))

comment: The zero vector is a vector. ( ~ ax-hv0cl analog.) (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2014.)
